prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was acquired through gift and purchase.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Thirty-Second President, 1933-1945. Born: January 30, 1882 in Hyde Park, New York. Died: April 12, 1945 in Warm Springs, Georgia. Married to Anna Eleanor Roosevelt.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 148 items, chiefly letters by Roosevelt to various friends and politicians.

Photograph of Franklin D. Roosevelt [1931?]

scopecontent.p: Franklin D. Roosevelt with Charles G. Maphis and Henry Morgenthau on the steps of the Rotunda. UVa News Services photograph.

did.unittitle: Photographs of Franklin D. Roosevelt at Monticello [1936 July 4]

scopecontent.p: The photographs, taken by Atcheson Laughlin Hench, show Roosevelt arriving at Monticello and delivering a speech at the west front. Seven of the photographs are original prints and seven are enlargements with annotations by Hench. #9087

did.unittitle: Photographs of Franklin D. Roosevelt [1940 June 10]

scopecontent.p: Photographs of Roosevelt in Memorial Gymnasium delivering commencement address that included the line "On this 10th day of June, 1940, the hand that held the dagger has struck it into the back of its neighbor."

did.unittitle: Photograph of Franklin D. Roosevelt [1941]

scopecontent.p: Franklin D. Roosevelt in car at the entrance to Edwin Watson's house, Kenwood. Watson and Frances Nash Watson stand to Roosevelt's right. Photograph by Gene Wilson. #5793-c

did.unittitle: Photograph of Franklin D. Roosevelt [1944?]

scopecontent.p: Inscribed and signed by Roosevelt: "For Mrs. Alderman with my esteem and regards" #15846
